Risk Statement: S3 bucket accidentally exposed publicly leading to data disclosure.
Existing Controls: S3 Block Public Access, SCPs, Security Hub controls
Mitigating Controls (Planned): Enable BPA at account level; Config rule S3 public access prohibited

Risk Statement: IAM users with excessive privileges may perform unauthorized actions.
Vulnerability: Overly permissive policies (iam:* or admin access)
Mitigating Controls (Planned): Refactor policies, enforce least privilege, periodic reviews

Risk Statement: RDS snapshots unencrypted leading to data exposure if exfiltrated.
Existing Controls: KMS enabled for new DBs, Security Hub checks

Risk Statement: CloudTrail disabled in a region could prevent detection of malicious activity.
Vulnerability: Logging not enforced in all regions
Mitigating Controls (Planned): Enforce org-wide CloudTrail via SCP and AWS Config

Risk Statement: IAM root account usage may cause uncontrolled privileged actions.
Mitigating Controls (Planned): Remove root keys, CloudWatch alerts for root usage

Risk Statement: Misconfigured Security Groups expose EC2 instances to the internet.
Mitigating Controls (Planned): AWS Config deny open ports; SOC monitoring

Risk Statement: Lack of quarterly IAM access reviews may lead to excessive privileges.
Mitigating Controls (Planned): Enforce quarterly access reviews, automate reports

Risk Statement: RDS snapshots shared publicly by mistake may leak sensitive data.
Mitigating Controls (Planned): Config rules to detect/auto-remediate snapshot sharing

Risk Statement: GuardDuty disabled or not enabled in all accounts may reduce threat detection.
Mitigating Controls (Planned): Centralize via AWS Organizations, auto-enable GuardDuty

Risk Statement: Unencrypted EBS volumes may result in data exposure if stolen.
Mitigating Controls (Planned): Convert legacy volumes, enforce default encryption
